Posts.Content: Thank you all for your very kind words - I'm sorry I've been so tardy in replying.  I've been visiting my sister for a few days - my mum is late stage alzeimers and my dad died of lung cancer the year before last, so our poor family are going through it a bit!.   It's comforting to know that I'm not the only one struggling to cope, and it's not all in my head.  It seems I may still have a way to go yet though, which is a little disheartening.  Onwards and upwards! Love to you all. Sandra
Posts.Title: Struggling with recovery

Posts.Content: Hi there, I was diagnosed with breast cancer in October 2012, and have since had the lumpectomy, FEC chemotherapy and radiotherapy, which finished at the end of June.  I found all the treatments hard going, and was signed off work half way through my chemo.  I returned to work at the end of August, on a phased return, working just three half days a week.  Since then, I haven't felt able to increase my hours at all, and am struggling to cope, not only with work, but with all daily chores such as cooking, cleaning and shopping.  I feel very guilty about this, as though its down to a lack of moral fibre.  I'm taking a whole raft of vitamins and supplements to try to increase my energy levels, and try to make sure I get some exercise, so I don't really know what else to do.  I live on my own, which doesn't really help.  Even my teeth feel tired.  Brain appears to have been decommissioned. Is this in any way normal?
Posts.Title: Struggling with recovery
